describe: Portugal is a southern European country on the Iberian Peninsula, bordering Spain. Its location on the Atlantic Ocean has influenced many aspects of its culture: salt cod and grilled sardines are national dishes, the Algarve's beaches are a major destination, and much of the nation's architecture dates to the 1500s‚Äì1800s, when Portugal had a powerful maritime empire.

cities.name: üèù Lisbon
cities.geographical_location: Located on the western coast of Portugal, along the Atlantic Ocean.
cities.climate: Lisbon has a Mediterranean climate with mild, rainy winters and warm, dry summers.

cities.name: üåâ Porto
cities.geographical_location: Situated along the Douro River estuary in northern Portugal.
cities.climate: Porto experiences a warm-summer Mediterranean climate, with mild, rainy winters and warm, dry summers.

cities.name: üèù Funchal
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southern coast of Madeira Island, in the Atlantic Ocean.
cities.climate: Funchal has a subtropical Mediterranean climate, with mild, wet winters and warm, dry summers.
